question_sentence: Charlie Kirk, a prominent conservative political activist, was fatally shot this week. Where did the shooting occur?
evidence: Charlie Kirk was killed at an event at Utah Valley University. He was 31 years old.

question_sentence: Which tech giant unveiled major product upgrades this week?
evidence: Apple revealed the first major redesign of the iPhone in years on Tuesday with the launch of a new, thinner model called the iPhone Air. It was one of several product upgrades unveiled at the company’s annual hardware event.

question_sentence: Which of the following generated a massive “shock wave” in Mexico City?
evidence: A gas truck explosion in Mexico City on Wednesday killed several people and left dozens injured. The blast also damaged more than 30 nearby vehicles, the Mexico City Prosecutor’s Office said.

question_sentence: Which of the following sparked widespread frustration in South Korea this week?
choices: Detention of South Korean workers in an ICE raid
Cancellation of a major US–Korea trade deal
evidence: Immigration authorities recently detained more than 300 South Korean workers in Georgia. News of the detentions triggered backlash in South Korea, a longstanding US ally that earlier this year pledged to invest hundreds of billions of dollars in the American economy.

question_sentence: Which celestial event recently caused the moon to appear a deep reddish color?
evidence: A lunar eclipse was visible Sunday across Europe, Africa, Asia and Australia, as the moon passed through Earth’s shadow. During this alignment, sunlight bending around Earth cast red wavelengths onto the moon, creating what is known as a “blood moon.”

question_sentence: Which country has been rocked by deadly protests, led primarily by young people against a social media ban?
evidence: Nepal's prime minister resigned after dozens of people were killed and hundreds were injured during youth-led protests this week.

question_sentence: Which viral toy is being counterfeited and sold in large quantities, both domestically and internationally?
evidence: Labubu dolls are the must-have toys of the year ... but so are the fakes. Chinese authorities have removed more than 1.8 million counterfeit Labubus from the market.

question_sentence: Which two states recently sold winning tickets for the nearly $1.8 billion Powerball jackpot?
evidence: Two Powerball tickets sold in Missouri and Texas won the nearly $1.8 billion jackpot, ending a streak of 42 consecutive drawings with no one claiming the prize.

question_sentence: Which tech CEO was offered a historic pay package potentially worth $1 trillion?
evidence: esla’s board of directors has agreed to offer CEO Elon Musk a pay package worth $1 trillion.

question_sentence: Which tennis player recently won his second US Open title?
evidence: Carlos Alcaraz won his second US Open title, defeating Jannik Sinner in four sets.
